content.description: This is the first route that is climbable on Convoy Wall. It is the right side crack of a detached pillar. Climb fingers to hands and finish in the wide stuff. On the opposite side of the pillar is a 2-pin anchor on the main wall. Rapping this line will put you down the O.W nightmare called "Merge".
content.protection: Fingers to hands to off-width, start small dirty and end wide and clean. Cams 1 each #.5 , #.75, #1, #3, and #4. With the crux being right off the ground this is a good route to warm up on.

climbs.name: Piece a shit, pile monkey nuts.

content.description: Piece a shit pile, is located about 300 feet left of Merge. It is a perfect left facing dihedral, Indian Creek quality. Make a few moves through bigger cracks at the bottom and then into the 3/4 inch crack, lay back and power your way to the crux where the crack kicks left and you have to under cling finish with a sandy flop onto a perch with two rap bolts.
content.protection: Perfect BD #.75 all the way up, bring about 5.

content.description: Merge is the crack on the left side of the detached pillar, starting about 15 feet up above a ramp. Scramble up the low angle and get right to the base of a 4 to 6 inch off-width (left Facing). The name says it all, you can't get in the thing like you want to until you are 3 feet from the anchor, makes it quite interesting. Lay it back and go for it, the edge is pretty round and the feet are sparse, good luck.
content.protection: Bring the big Stuff, 3- #4's, and a #4.5 cam should do the trick. It is named this way for a reason.
